sub_topic: Finding the volume of a sphere inscribed in a cube.
message_1: What is the volume of a sphere inscribed in a cube with edge length of 6 cm?
message_2:
A sphere inscribed in a cube touches the cube at the center of each face. Therefore, the diameter of the sphere is equal to the edge length of the cube.

The diameter of the sphere is 6 cm, so the radius (r) is half of that, which is 3 cm.

The formula for the volume of a sphere is (4/3)πr^3.

Substitute the value of r into the formula:

Volume = (4/3)π(3 cm)^3
Volume = (4/3)π(27 cm^3)
Volume = (4π(27))/3
Volume = (108π)/3
Volume = 36π cm^3

The volume of the sphere inscribed in a cube with an edge length of 6 cm is 36π cubic centimeters.
